intro: Eriosema trinerve, commonly known as the three-veined eriosema, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the Fabaceae family, which includes legumes, and is characterized by its trifoliate leaves with three leaflets. The plant produces small, delicate flowers that are typically pink or purple in color. Eriosema trinerve is often found in grasslands and open woodlands, thriving in well-drained soils. Its botanical features make it an interesting subject for both horticultural and ecological studies.
